title: π§πͺ Belgium: Mustii's Eurovision 2024 Song to Be Revealed in February
text:
π§πͺ Belgium: Mustii's Eurovision 2024 Song to Be Revealed in February
In an interview with VRT, Mustii has revealed that his song for Eurovision 2024 will be revealed in February.
Mustii was internally selected by the Belgian French-language broadcaster, RTBF, to represent Belgium at the 2024 Eurovision Song Contest, in MalmΓΆ. You can find out more on this thoughts and feelings here.
In his first interview with VRT about his Eurovision participation, Mustii speaks on his hopes for the style and future of his song that will represent Belgium at Eurovision 2024:
“My idea is to go to the Eurovision Song Contest with my own DNA. I don’t want to lie, I want to be sincere and authentic. I don’t want to create a fake character.” … “But I have been working in the studio for a while. I also want the song to be part of an album and not just a random song for the Eurovision Song Contest.”
Within the interview, Mustii speaks about his current music style, which could give a clue on what we can expect to hear in February, next year:
“My style evolves into pop with a dark edge. I have influences from new wave and rock, but they remain pop albums. I contrast pop with fragile subjects, I like to play with them. My last album, for example, was a homage to my uncle who had schizophrenia.”
You can find out more about Mustii’s interview with VRT here.
Mustii is the first artist confirmed to be competing at the 68th Eurovision Song Contest, for Belgium.
Eurovision 2024
Loreen won the 67th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest for Sweden with βTattooβ?. She is the first female two-time winner of the competition, having previously won the 2012 contest with βEuphoriaβ?.
MalmΓΆ has hosted the Eurovision Song Contest twice previously. The first time was in 1992 while the most recent edition was in 2013. Eurovision 2024 will be held on May 7, 9 and 11.
The venue where Eurovision Song Contest 2024 will take place is the MalmΓΆ Arena, the second-largest indoor arena in Sweden.
Image Source: RTBF | Source: VRT
Belgium in the Eurovision Song Contest Belgium was one of the original seven nations to participate in the first edition of the Eurovision Song Contest in 1956. To date, the country has won the contest only once in 1986. Sandra Kim won the contest with the song βJβaime la vieβ?. Her victory was not without controversy when it emerged that Sandra was just 13 years old, two years younger than the age restriction at the time. In the late 00s, Belgium struggled in the contest failing to reach the final annually from 2005 until 2010, when Tom Dice finished 6th in the final with 143 points. Belgium has finished last at the contest six times, including two sets of nul points.
